docs.lead_paragraph: A Red Cross team was attacked while collecting bodies believed to be infected with Ebola in southeastern Guinea, the latest in a string of assaults that are hindering efforts to control West Africa's current outbreak.

headline.main: Red Cross Team Attacked While Burying Ebola Dead
headline.print_headline: Red Cross Team Attacked While Burying Ebola Dead

docs.snippet: A Red Cross team was attacked while collecting bodies believed to be infected with Ebola in southeastern Guinea, the latest in a string of assaults that are hindering efforts to control West Africa's current outbreak.

headline.main: Is Exercise Bad for Your Teeth?

docs.abstract: Vigorous exercise is good for almost all of the body — except perhaps the teeth, according to a surprising new study of athletes.
docs.snippet: Vigorous exercise is good for almost all of the body — except perhaps the teeth, according to a surprising new study of athletes.

docs.lead_paragraph: A reader notes that our water supply is not the only source of lithium.
docs.snippet: A reader notes that our water supply is not the only source of lithium.

docs.lead_paragraph: The three companies said they would change practices like marketing to encourage less consumption of calorie-heavy drinks.

headline.main: Soda Makers Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and Dr Pepper Join in Effort to Cut Americans’ Drink Calories
headline.print_headline: Big Soda Makers Agree on Effort to Cut Americans’ Drink Calories

docs.abstract: Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and Dr Pepper Snapple Group, three largest soda companies, pledge to cut number of sugary drink calories that Americans consume by one-fifth in about a decade; say they will change practices like marketing, distribution and packaging to encourage less consumption of calorie-heavy drinks.
docs.snippet: The three companies said they would change practices like marketing to encourage less consumption of calorie-heavy drinks.

docs.lead_paragraph: Baseball Commissioner Bud Selig hopes one day Derek Jeter will own a team after the 40-year-old shortstop retires as a player.

headline.main: Selig Hopes Jeter Will Wind Up Owning Team
headline.print_headline: Selig Hopes Jeter Will Wind Up Owning Team

docs.snippet: Baseball Commissioner Bud Selig hopes one day Derek Jeter will own a team after the 40-year-old shortstop retires as a player.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. drugstore chain operator Walgreen Co is exploring the sale of a majority stake in its infusion services business, in a deal that could value that division at around $1.5 billion, according to four people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: Walgreen Explores Sale of $1.5 Billion Infusion Business: Sources
headline.print_headline: Walgreen Explores Sale of $1.5 Billion Infusion Business: Sources

docs.snippet: U.S. drugstore chain operator Walgreen Co is exploring the sale of a majority stake in its infusion services business, in a deal that could value that division at around $1.5 billion, according to four people familiar with the matter.

docs.lead_paragraph: Coke, Pepsi and Dr Pepper said Tuesday they'll work to reduce the calories Americans get from beverages by 20 percent over the next decade by more aggressively marketing smaller sizes, bottled water and diet drinks.

headline.main: Soda Makers Pledge to Reduce Calorie Consumption
headline.print_headline: Soda Makers Pledge to Reduce Calorie Consumption

docs.snippet: Coke, Pepsi and Dr Pepper said Tuesday they'll work to reduce the calories Americans get from beverages by 20 percent over the next decade by more aggressively marketing smaller sizes, bottled water and diet drinks.

headline.main: Spanking Isn't Culture. It's a Cycle of Abuse.

docs.abstract: Adrian Peterson shouldn’t sell himself short. He is where he is today in spite of his father, not because of him, and what he learned from him now threatens his career and his family.
docs.snippet: Adrian Peterson shouldn’t sell himself short. He is where he is today in spite of his father, not because of him, and what he learned from him now threatens his career and his family.
